title: Keen Dreams Q
content:
Is it worth getting the legal [full] version of Keen 5, cause from what I've heard there's not much to gain by going from shareware to full ware or whatever you call the legel version.---

title: Re: Keen Dreams Q
content:
You mean Keen Dreams, since there's no Keen 5 shareware.
Anyways, the full version has nothing the shareware doesn't have, except the title screen is different, and the ending story is a bit different (IIRC).Eat your veggies!

title: huh
content:
I thought Keen Dreams was Keen 5? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-poisonslug.gif[/img] ---

title: Re: huh
content: Nope. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Keen Dreams was released before Keen 4. It's often called Keen 3.5.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: huh
content: It's more of a standalone game. It was made after Keen 3 (Keen Must Die) and before Keen 4 (Secret of the Oracle). Keen 5 is part of the Goodbye Galaxy series (which includes Keen 4 and 5) and is titled 'The Armageddon Machine'.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]
